alert.note: Alert for Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 11 at 3:41AM CDT until July 11 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Oklahoma County in central Oklahoma... * Until 645 AM CDT. * At 341 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oklahoma City, western Edmond, Midwest City, Del City, Bethany, Warr Acres, The Village, Spencer, Nichols Hills, Tinker Air Force Base, Forest Park, Lake Aluma, The Capitol and Downtown Edmond. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious pre dawn when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
